definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
horizontal bar to hold a door closed (made of wood or metal)/door bolt
latch/bolt (to lock a door or window)

sentences.english: But the fish gate did the sons of Hassenaah build, who also laid the beams thereof, and set up the doors thereof, the locks thereof, and the bars thereof.
sentences.chinese: 哈西拿的子孙建立鱼门，架横梁，安门扇，和闩锁。

sentences.english: But they didn't realize that ATMs are bolted to the floor.
sentences.chinese: 但是他们没有意识到，提款机是闩在地上的。

sentences.english: Protected, high-temperature, hall-effect latch with active pull-down.
sentences.chinese: 保护，高温，霍尔效应闩锁与有源下拉。

sentences.english: The window fastens with a hook.
sentences.chinese: 这窗户用一只钩子闩紧。

sentences.english: She would let go, take a few awkward strokes, and latch on again.
sentences.chinese: 她将放开，需要几年的尴尬中风，并再次闩上。

sentences.english: Everyone was asleep behind bolted doors.
sentences.chinese: 屋里的人都闩门熟睡着。

sentences.english: Since this staircase is rather dark, we must feel our way carefully.
sentences.chinese: 既然此楼梯间卮雒黑暗，我们必须感觉闩逶小心地。

sentences.english: Bar the barn door so the cows can't get out.
sentences.chinese: 闩上牲口棚门以免牛跑出去。

sentences.english: Ordering a fixed limit for it, with locks and doors;
sentences.chinese: 为它定界限，又安门和闩。

sentences.english: Swivel door latch snib by90? And pull it inwards .
sentences.chinese: 旋转车门锁闩销90？并向里拉。

sentences.english: Also overlay the crossbars with gold.
It is in the construction of underground structures that bolting has had its greatest application.
sentences.chinese: 介绍在地下结构的建筑闩上它才有最巨大的应用。

definition: variant of 門閂|门闩[men2 shuan1]
horizontal bar to hold a door closed (made of wood or metal)/door bolt
to stand as a goalkeeper/to keep guard on a gate
door knocker (in the shape of a ring)
bolt (for locking a window, cabinet etc)/(electrical) plug
(to move or do sth) softly and quietly (idiom)
